title: Shocking Claim: Researchers Expose OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-4o Training on Paywalled Books
body: Is OpenAI, the giant behind ChatGPT, embroiled in another data sourcing controversy? A new report from the AI Disclosures Project is making waves with a serious accusation : OpenAI may have trained its advanced GPT-4o model using copyrighted, paywalled books from O‚ÄôReilly Media without permission. This revelation intensifies the ongoing debate about AI training data ethics and the boundaries of copyright in the age of artificial intelligence. For crypto enthusiasts and tech-savvy individuals following the AI revolution, this news raises critical questions about data transparency and the future of content creation. Unpacking the Copyright Infringement Claim Against OpenAI The core of the accusation revolves around the source of data used to train sophisticated AI models like GPT-4o. Think of AI models as incredibly complex learning machines. They digest massive amounts of information ‚Äì text, images, code ‚Äì to identify patterns and generate outputs based on prompts. When you ask ChatGPT to write a poem or create an image, it‚Äôs drawing upon this vast knowledge base to produce its response. It‚Äôs not creating something entirely new, but rather intelligently remixing and extrapolating from what it has learned. While many AI labs, including OpenAI, are exploring AI-generated synthetic data to augment their training datasets, relying solely on synthetic data presents challenges. Performance can degrade, and the models may lose touch with the nuances of real-world data. This is where the controversy around AI training data sourcing becomes critical. The AI Disclosures Project, spearheaded by Tim O‚ÄôReilly and Ilan Strauss, suggests that OpenAI‚Äôs latest model, GPT-4o , exhibits a strong understanding of content from paywalled O‚ÄôReilly books. This is particularly concerning because O‚ÄôReilly Media, a prominent publisher of technical and business books, does not have a licensing agreement with OpenAI. Key findings from the AI Disclosures Project paper: GPT-4o‚Äôs Superior Recognition: The research indicates that GPT-4o demonstrates a significantly higher recognition of paywalled O‚ÄôReilly book content compared to OpenAI‚Äôs earlier model, GPT-3.5 Turbo. DE-COP Method: The researchers employed a technique called DE-COP, a ‚Äúmembership inference attack,‚Äù to assess whether AI models have prior knowledge of specific texts from their training data. This method tests if a model can distinguish between original human-written text and AI-paraphrased versions. Extensive Testing: Over 13,000 paragraph excerpts from 34 O‚ÄôReilly books were used to probe the knowledge of GPT-4o, GPT-3.5 Turbo, and other OpenAI models. Paywalled Content Recognition: The results strongly suggest that GPT-4o ‚Äúrecognized‚Äù a far greater amount of paywalled O‚ÄôReilly book content than its predecessors. GPT-4o and the Mystery of Paywalled Books: What Does It Mean for Copyright? The paper highlights a stark contrast between GPT-4o and older models like GPT-3.5 Turbo. While GPT-3.5 Turbo showed more familiarity with publicly accessible O‚ÄôReilly book samples, GPT-4o excelled in recognizing content behind paywalls. This raises serious questions about how OpenAI sourced its AI training data for its most advanced model. According to the research, ‚ÄúGPT-4o [likely] recognizes, and so has prior knowledge of, many non-public O‚ÄôReilly books published prior to its training cutoff date.‚Äù However, the researchers acknowledge that this isn‚Äôt definitive proof of copyright infringement . They concede that their method isn‚Äôt foolproof and that OpenAI could have indirectly accessed the book excerpts through user interactions with ChatGPT ‚Äì users might have copied and pasted snippets of paywalled content into the platform. Furthermore, the study didn‚Äôt analyze OpenAI‚Äôs newest models, leaving open the possibility that data sourcing practices may have evolved. Why Does AI Training Data Matter in the Crypto and Tech World? For those in the cryptocurrency and broader tech space, the implications of this copyright infringement claim are significant: Data Ethics and Transparency: The crypto world champions decentralization and transparency. Questions around AI data sourcing mirror these concerns. Where AI models get their data and how ethically it‚Äôs obtained are crucial for building trustworthy AI systems. Impact on Content Creators: If AI models are trained on copyrighted material without proper licensing, it undermines the rights of content creators ‚Äì authors, artists, musicians, and more. This could stifle creativity and innovation in the long run. Legal Battles and Regulatory Scrutiny: OpenAI is already facing multiple lawsuits regarding its data practices. This new report will likely add fuel to the fire, potentially leading to stricter regulations around AI training data and copyright . Future of AI Development: The search for high-quality AI training data is intensifying. AI companies are exploring various avenues, including licensing deals, synthetic data generation, and even hiring domain experts to inject knowledge directly into AI systems. The resolution of the copyright infringement debate will significantly shape the future landscape of AI development. OpenAI‚Äôs Stance and the Broader Industry Trend OpenAI has publicly advocated for more flexible rules regarding the use of copyrighted data for AI training . They argue that access to a wide range of data, including copyrighted material, is essential for developing powerful and beneficial AI models. The company does have licensing agreements with some publishers and offers opt-out mechanisms for copyright holders, though these are often criticized as insufficient. The trend of AI companies seeking higher-quality AI training data is undeniable. OpenAI has even hired journalists to refine its models‚Äô output, and the industry is seeing a rise in AI firms recruiting experts across various fields to infuse specialized knowledge into AI systems. While OpenAI does pay for some training data through licensing deals, the O‚ÄôReilly paper underscores the ongoing tension between AI development and copyright law. As OpenAI navigates multiple lawsuits and increasing scrutiny, this new report from the AI Disclosures Project adds another layer of complexity to the copyright infringement debate. OpenAI did not respond to requests for comment, leaving the allegations unanswered for now. title: Australian Crypto Investor Andre Rebelo Sentenced to 25 Years for Murdering His Mother
body: Key Takeaways: A crypto investor‚Äôs hidden financial strain fuels an unthinkable act against a close family member. The case challenges our assumptions about wealth and exposes risky behavior behind online allure. It sparks debate on how financial pressures can distort personal values and family ties. Andre Rebelo, an Australian crypto investor and former partner of Instagram influencer Grace Piscopo, was sentenced to 25 years in prison on April 1 in Perth after being found guilty of murdering his mother in 2020. Andre Rebelo Sentenced for Killing Mother in High-Profile Case Rebelo was convicted of murdering his mother, Colleen, after an eight-week trial where his siblings and ex-girlfriend testified. Colleen Rebelo was found dead in the shower of her suburban home in Perth on May 25, 2020, by her son. Authorities did not determine an exact cause of death, though some reports suggested possible asphyxiation. Andre Rebelo ‚Äî the ex-partner of social media influencer Grace Piscopo ‚Äî must have carried out some form of violent act against his mother when he killed her but exactly what he did may never be known. https://t.co/LrhqdfCWEB ‚Äî The West Australian (@westaustralian) March 31, 2025 ‚ÄúYou killed your own mother, in a particularly egregious and shocking nature,‚Äù Justice Bruno Fiannaca said. ‚ÄúThis is a crime that right minded people would regard with horror, murdering your mother was the ultimate betrayal of her trust and everything she gave,‚Äù he added. Debt and Financial Motives Behind Andre Rebelo‚Äôs Crime According to The Sydney Morning Herald , Colleen‚Äôs therapist, Narina Sidhu, alerted police shortly following her client‚Äôs death that Rebelo had repeatedly contacted her about signing a life insurance claim in his mother‚Äôs name. Authorities found that Rebelo had created the policies himself and forged documents to claim up to AUD $1 million (around USD $627,000). Prosecutors said Rebelo and Piscopo had accumulated nearly AUD $100,000 (about USD $62,000) in debt due to their spending habits, which may have influenced Rebelo‚Äôs actions. The investigation did not uncover clear details about Rebelo‚Äôs cryptocurrency investments , but prosecutors focused instead on his financial struggles and motive. Social Media Activity and Final Sentencing Piscopo, who shares a child with Rebelo and has since separated from him, did not attend the sentencing. Two days before the sentencing, Piscopo shared a beach photo from Bali on Instagram, captioned ‚Äúparadise.‚Äù Rebelo will be eligible for parole in 2047, after serving at least 25 years. title: Landmark STABLES Act: Coinbase CEO‚Äôs Urgent Plea for Crypto Regulation Support
body: Is the U.S. finally on the verge of establishing a clear regulatory framework for digital assets? Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong believes we might be. In a significant move, Armstrong has publicly urged bipartisan support for the STABLES Act, labeling its upcoming markup by the House Financial Services Committee as a potentially ‚Äúhistoric moment‚Äù for the crypto industry. Let‚Äôs dive into why this act is so crucial and what it could mean for the future of crypto in the United States. Why is the STABLES Act a Landmark for Crypto Regulation? The STABLES Act , or the ‚ÄúEliminating Backlogs Act of 2023‚Äù, is not new, but its renewed momentum is capturing significant attention. Brian Armstrong‚Äôs vocal support amplifies its importance, especially as the crypto industry navigates a complex and often unclear regulatory landscape. But what exactly makes this act so pivotal? Clarity for Stablecoins: The core focus of the STABLES Act is to provide regulatory clarity for stablecoins. Stablecoins, cryptocurrencies designed to maintain a stable value relative to a reserve asset like the U.S. dollar, are crucial for everyday crypto transactions and the broader DeFi ecosystem. Current regulations are fragmented, creating uncertainty for businesses operating with stablecoins. Federal Oversight: The act proposes to bring stablecoin issuers under federal oversight, potentially treating them more like traditional financial institutions. This could involve stricter requirements for reserves, audits, and consumer protection, aiming to build trust and stability in the stablecoin market. National Framework: A federal framework could preempt state-level regulations, creating a more unified and less burdensome environment for stablecoin issuers to operate across the U.S. This national approach is highly desired by industry leaders who seek consistent rules rather than a patchwork of state laws. Brian Armstrong‚Äôs Urgent Call for Support: A Pivotal Moment Brian Armstrong‚Äôs engagement is not just a casual endorsement; it‚Äôs an urgent call to action. His recent activity on X (formerly Twitter), highlighting both the STABLES Act and the Senate‚Äôs progress on the GENIUS Act, underscores the industry‚Äôs push for comprehensive crypto regulation . Why is his voice so important right now? Industry Leadership: As the CEO of Coinbase, a leading cryptocurrency exchange in the U.S., Armstrong‚Äôs opinion carries significant weight. His advocacy can influence both lawmakers and the broader public perception of crypto regulation. Timing is Critical: With the House Financial Services Committee markup approaching, Armstrong‚Äôs public appeal is strategically timed to maximize pressure on lawmakers to consider and support the STABLES Act. This is a crucial window of opportunity to shape the future of digital assets regulation. Bipartisan Push: Armstrong specifically called for bipartisan support, recognizing that for any legislation to pass and be effective, it needs to transcend partisan divides. Crypto regulation is not a Republican or Democrat issue; it‚Äôs an issue of innovation and economic competitiveness for the U.S. Beyond STABLES: The GENIUS Act and a Broader Vision for Digital Assets Armstrong also mentioned the Senate‚Äôs progress on the GENIUS Act. While the STABLES Act focuses on stablecoins, the GENIUS Act represents a broader effort to establish a comprehensive digital asset framework . How do these pieces fit together? Act Focus Significance STABLES Act Stablecoin regulation, federal oversight of issuers. Provides immediate clarity and stability to a critical segment of the crypto market. GENIUS Act Broader digital asset regulatory framework, potentially covering various types of cryptocurrencies and crypto activities. Aims to create a more comprehensive and future-proof regulatory environment for the entire digital asset ecosystem in the U.S. Both acts are vital components of building a robust and innovation-friendly regulatory landscape for crypto in the U.S. Armstrong‚Äôs mention of both signals a holistic approach, advocating for both immediate needs (stablecoin clarity) and long-term vision (comprehensive framework). What are the Potential Benefits of Clear Crypto Regulation? Why is this regulatory push so important for the future? Clear crypto regulation offers numerous benefits, not just for crypto companies but for the entire U.S. economy: Increased Investment and Innovation: Regulatory clarity reduces uncertainty, making it more attractive for institutional investors and traditional businesses to enter the crypto space. This influx of capital and talent can fuel innovation and growth. Consumer Protection: Robust regulations can protect consumers from fraud and scams, fostering greater trust in digital assets and encouraging wider adoption. Economic Competitiveness: A clear and sensible regulatory framework can position the U.S. as a leader in the digital asset space, attracting businesses and talent while preventing innovation from moving overseas. Mainstream Adoption: As regulations become clearer and more established, cryptocurrencies and digital assets can move closer to mainstream adoption, integrating further into the traditional financial system. Armstrong in D.C.: Actionable Insights and What‚Äôs Next Brian Armstrong‚Äôs presence in Washington, D.C., this week is not merely symbolic. It represents direct engagement and lobbying efforts ahead of the crucial August recess. What actionable insights can we glean from this situation? Direct Engagement Matters: Armstrong‚Äôs meetings with lawmakers demonstrate the importance of direct industry engagement in shaping policy. Crypto leaders need to be actively involved in discussions and negotiations. Education is Key: Part of Armstrong‚Äôs mission is likely to educate lawmakers about the nuances of crypto and the potential benefits of well-crafted regulation. Bridging the knowledge gap between the tech industry and policymakers is crucial. Momentum Building: The simultaneous progress on the STABLES Act and the GENIUS Act, coupled with industry advocacy, suggests a growing momentum towards comprehensive crypto regulation in the U.S. This is a space to watch closely. Conclusion: A Historic Opportunity for Digital Assets? The upcoming House Financial Services Committee markup of the STABLES Act, combined with the ongoing Senate discussions on the GENIUS Act, truly represents a historic opportunity for the United States to define its stance on digital assets . Brian Armstrong‚Äôs urgent appeal for bipartisan support is a powerful reminder that the time for decisive action is now. Whether this moment will indeed be ‚Äúhistoric‚Äù depends on the choices lawmakers make in the coming weeks and months. The crypto community, and indeed anyone interested in the future of finance and technology, will be watching closely. body: Key Takeaways: The U.S. Treasury is set to disclose its crypto holdings, which could transform digital assets into strategic national reserves and shift government policy toward legitimizing cryptocurrencies. The SBR in particular, will hold Bitcoin acquired through criminal or civil forfeiture with a mandate not to sell the BTC‚Äîakin to a ‚Äúdigital Fort Knox‚Äù for long-term value storage. title: Rep French Hill Rejects Proposal for Interest on Stablecoin Holdings
body: During a briefing on April 1, Representative French Hill addressed the ongoing discussions surrounding the regulation of stablecoins. One key aspect that has garnered attention is the proposal to allow consumers to earn interest on their stablecoin holdings. However, Hill rejected this proposal, stating that there is no consensus among lawmakers to support it. The debate has become a point of focus as the U.S. Congress moves closer to passing new legislation for stablecoins. French Hill Points Lack of Consensus Among Lawmakers Rep. French Hill, who represents Arkansas, made it clear that there is currently no agreement on the proposal for consumers to earn interest on stablecoins. In his remarks, Hill acknowledged the concerns of those advocating for this change but emphasized the lack of consensus among both the House and Senate. ‚ÄúI hear the point of view but I don‚Äôt think that there‚Äôs consensus among the parties or the houses on having a dollar-backed payment stablecoin pay interest to the holder of that stablecoin,‚Äù Hill stated during the briefing. French Hill comments come as part of ongoing discussions on the ‚ÄúSTABLE Act‚Äù (H.R. 2392), which seeks to regulate stablecoins in the U.S. The legislation, in addition, aims to provide clear guidelines for stablecoin issuers and establish a framework for how these digital assets can be used in financial transactions. Industry leaders and cryptocurrency advocates have voiced their concerns over the current legislative direction. Opening the door for onchain interest will force us all to up our game for the ultimate benefit of consumers,‚Äù Armstrong said in a recent statement. title: Bitcoin traders are overstating the impact of the US-led tariff war on BTC price
body: Despite Bitcoin‚Äôs 2.2% gains on April 1, BTC ( BTC ) hasn‚Äôt traded above $89,000 since March 7. Even though the recent price weakness is often linked to the escalating US-led global trade war, several factors had already been weighing on investor sentiment long before President Donald Trump announced the tariffs. Some market participants claimed that Strategy‚Äôs $5.25 billion worth of Bitcoin purchases since February is the primary reason BTC has held above the $80,000 support. But, regardless of who has been buying, the reality is that Bitcoin was already showing limited upside before President Trump announced the 10% Chinese import tariffs on Jan. 21. Gold/USD (left) vs. Bitcoin/USD (right). Source: TradingView / Cointelegraph The S&P 500 index hit an all-time high on Feb. 19, exactly 30 days after the trade war began, while Bitcoin had repeatedly failed to hold above $100,000 for the previous three months. Although the trade war certainly affected investor risk appetite, strong evidence suggests Bitcoin's price weakness started well before President Trump took office on Jan. 20. Spot Bitcoin ETFs inflows, strategic Bitcoin reserve expectations and inflationary trends Another data point that weakens the relation with tariffs is the spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs), which saw $2.75 billion in net inflows during the three weeks following Jan. 21. By Feb. 18, the US had announced plans to impose tariffs on imports from Canada and Mexico, while the European Union and China had already retaliated. In essence, institutional demand for Bitcoin persisted even as the trade war escalated. Part of Bitcoin traders‚Äô disappointment after Jan. 21 stems from excessive expectations surrounding President Trump‚Äôs campaign promise of a ‚Äústrategic national Bitcoin stockpile,‚Äù mentioned at the Bitcoin Conference in July 2024. As investors grew impatient, their frustration peaked when the actual executive order was issued on March 6. A key factor behind Bitcoin‚Äôs struggle to break above $89,000 is an inflationary trend, reflecting a relatively successful strategy by global central banks. In February, the US Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) Price Index rose 2.5% year-over-year, while the eurozone Consumer Price Index (CPI) increased by 2.2% in March. Investors turn more risk-averse following weak job market data In the second half of 2022, Bitcoin‚Äôs gains were driven by inflation soaring above 5%, suggesting that businesses and families turned to cryptocurrency as a hedge against monetary debasement. However, if inflation remains relatively under control in 2025, lower interest rates would favor real estate and stock markets more directly than Bitcoin, as reduced financing costs boost those sectors. US CPI inflation (left) vs. US 2-year Treasury yield (right). Source: TradingView Related: Coinbase sees worst quarter since FTX collapse amid industry bloodbath The weakening job market also dampens traders‚Äô demand for risk-on assets, including Bitcoin. In February, the US Labor Department reported job openings near a four-year low. Similarly, yields on the US 2-year Treasury fell to a six-month low, with investors accepting a modest 3.88% return for the safety of government-backed instruments. This data suggests a rising choice for risk aversion, which is unfavorable for Bitcoin. Ultimately, Bitcoin‚Äôs price weakness stems from investors' unrealistic expectations of BTC acquisitions by the US Treasury, declining inflation supporting potential interest rate cuts, and a more risk-averse macroeconomic environment as investors turn to short-term government bonds. While the trade war has had negative effects, Bitcoin was already showing signs of weakness before it began. title: Elon Musk accuses Biden of diverting billions in Social Security funds as D.O.G.E moves to cut benefits
body: Elon Musk claimed at a rally in Wisconsin that President Joe Biden let millions of noncitizens collect Social Security numbers during his time in office. Elon brought charts, handed out $1 million checks, and used a packed town hall to accuse Biden of funneling taxpayer funds into what he called a broken system. The rally happened just a day and a half before polls opened in a high-stakes state judicial election. The event grabbed national attention after Elon gave the money to two Wisconsin voters who signed a petition against ‚Äúactivist judges.‚Äù That petition followed a ruling from the Wisconsin Supreme Court, which refused to hear a case saying the giveaway was illegal. After the checks, Elon brought up his DOGE associate Antonio Gracias to talk about what they uncovered inside the Social Security Administration. Behind them, a large slide appeared with the words ‚ÄúNew Non-Citizen Social Security Numbers Issued.‚Äù Antonio explained what it meant. Elon Musk at the rally event. Source: Fox News/Getty Images ‚ÄúWe started at the top of the system, mapping the whole system of Social Security to understand where all the fraud was,‚Äù Antonio said during the event. ‚ÄúBut this is what jumped out at us. When we saw these numbers, we were like, ‚ÄòWhat is this?‚Äô‚Äù Antonio said that between fiscal year 2021 and fiscal year 2025, noncitizens were issued Social Security numbers in growing numbers. In fiscal year 2024 alone, more than 2 million received them. The year before that, and even in fiscal year 2025 which began in October and runs through this September, the number was around 1 million each year. ‚ÄúThis literally blew us away,‚Äù Antonio said. ‚ÄúWe went there to find fraud and we found this by accident.‚Äù Elon‚Äôs Social Security overhaul may slow checks and support Jason Fichtner, who served as deputy commissioner of the Social Security Administration under President George W. Bush, said things are getting risky. ‚ÄúNow I‚Äôm concerned that benefits could get disrupted,‚Äù he said. Jason said these new updates aren‚Äôt small tweaks‚Äîthey could block people from getting help at all. Jason joined Kathleen Romig, another former SSA official and now director of Social Security and disability policy at the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities, in a public op-ed. They wrote that 7,000 workers have been removed from the SSA, and six regional offices have been shut down. That means fewer people to help, longer lines at field offices, and more bugs on the official SSA website. The phone line? It already had long waits before the layoffs. Now it‚Äôs worse. Kathleen and Jason said this mess could hit people with disabilities hardest. Delays could leave them waiting so long they die before getting the money they‚Äôre owed. ‚ÄúThe Social Security Administration is in crisis, and people‚Äôs benefits are at risk,‚Äù they wrote. Jason also spoke about DOGE‚Äôs plan to wipe out COBOL, the old programming language that runs millions of lines of SSA code. DOGE wants to rebuild the entire system in a few months. Jason said that‚Äôs reckless. ‚ÄúIf you start messing with the system‚Äôs code, that could impact those who are currently getting benefits now,‚Äù he said. Normally, a change like that would take years. It would start with one state, then move out slowly to other regions. Jason said DOGE isn‚Äôt doing that. Instead, they‚Äôre forcing everything through in a tight window, with no time for test runs or slow rollouts. Jason said he wasn‚Äôt too worried at first. He knew there were service delays, but he didn‚Äôt think people‚Äôs monthly checks were at risk. But now, with this COBOL plan moving full speed, he said it‚Äôs a whole new problem. The Social Security Administration responded by email saying, ‚ÄúThere is no validity to these reports.‚Äù The White House used the same exact words too, oddly enough. title: Backpack exchange begins asset recovery for former FTX EU customers
body: Backpack Exchange started off a formal procedure to help former FTX EU clients recover their funds. The company launched a claims process on April 1, 2025, to help return assets to affected users. The firm posted a link on X that former FTX EU customers can use to identify themselves. Former customers must complete a know-your-customer (KYC) to initiate the process of recovering any lost funds. Backpack Exchange rescues FTX EU, aims to expedite customer payouts Once one‚ÄÇof the world‚Äôs largest cryptocurrency exchanges, FTX collapsed in November 2022, leaving‚ÄÇmillions of users unable to access their funds . The company collapsed amid a liquidity crisis and fraud allegations. The news uncovered that Alameda Research, a closely related trading company to FTX, had invested billions of dollars of client funds in dubious investments. As clients flocked to withdraw their cash, FTX had insufficient funds to accommodate the demands, sending‚ÄÇinvestors into chaos and the company‚Äôs swift downfall. FTX and Alameda‚ÄÇResearch collapsed on November 11, 2022. Further investigations indicated‚ÄÇthat FTX‚Äôs founder and chief executive, Sam Bankman-Fried, had diverted customer deposits. He was charged and‚ÄÇconvicted of fraud and conspiracy. The European subsidiary, FTX EU, was also‚ÄÇimpacted. Even with the stricter European oversight, customer assets in‚ÄÇthe broader FTX bankruptcy were trapped. FTX EU was purchased in January 2025 by‚ÄÇBackpack Exchange, a regulated global cryptocurrency platform founded by ex-FTX and Alameda Research staff. The FTX bankruptcy court and the Cyprus Securities and Exchange Commission (CySEC) gave the acquisition the green light, allowing Backpack to‚ÄÇscale its services throughout Europe. As part of the acquisition, Backpack would have handled the distribution of court-eventually approved bankruptcy claims to FTX EU customers, with a target to speed up the restitution process. Backpack Exchange has structured a claims process to facilitate customer restitution Backpack Exchange has created a‚ÄÇsimple process to recover funds for the affected FTX EU clients. The process starts with identity verification, requiring users to utilize a responsive verification system. The step is live and can be accessed via Backpack‚Äôs official‚ÄÇclaims page. Users who have successfully passed the verification‚ÄÇprocess can then withdraw their funds. Backpack will share instructions as soon as the withdrawal phase goes live CEO Armani Ferrante stated that this‚ÄÇis a significant effort and reaffirmed restitution to customers as a central element of building trust and confidence across the industry. Backpack Exchange‚ÄÇhas also made extensive support accessible across supported channels to assist users in recovery. The community is reacting and sharing feedback on social media The request for the asset recovery process‚ÄÇbrought different views within the crypto ecosystem. Responses from‚ÄÇusers on the social media platform have been optimistic and sceptical. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a really‚ÄÇlong road for us,‚Äù one user posted . Another said,‚ÄÇ‚ÄúThis is the minimum they could do after all of this time. I hope it will not take long.‚Äù Another one stated. The structured claims process is a great step in the right direction to re-attach FTX EU customers‚Äô funds to the company while the company is now where it needed to‚ÄÇbe from the beginning, in the customer‚Äôs hands. As the Backpack Exchange aims to rebalance, however, the gaze of the cryptocurrency community will fall on‚ÄÇthem to secure their trust for good.
